page.title: 10RELIGION
page.content: Renfrew has a variety of forms of religious worship available. Like most of Scotland the main church is the Church of Scotland. Renfrew has 3: Old Parish, North and Trinity. North Church is distinguished by having as its minister Lorna Hood one of the few but increasing number of women ministers. Church attendance is above average and most people have some church connection. About 16% of the population is Roman Catholic catered for by its own school and 2 churches. There is a strong local membership of the Orange Lodge but this does not result in sectarianism within Renfrew. There are also Episcopalian, Baptist, Salvation Army and Jehovah's Witness churches in the town.
